reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Supporting Rwanda Toward End TB Strategy

description.narrative: Rwanda - Tuberculosis - Ministry of Health of the Republic of Rwanda - MOH. This program has the following goals: 37% reduction of TB mortality rate from 10.0/100,000 to 6.3/100,000 population. 23% reduction of TB incidence rate from 86.0/100,000 to 67.0/100,000 population. The objectives of this program are: Improve TB prevention (TB infection control in health facilities, behavioural change in the general population and prevention by medication) so that the percentage of the population with adequate knowledge of TB increases from 56% to 75% by 2018.. Increase treatment success rate from 88% to 90% for bacteriologically confirmed TB cases and maintain it at 87% for MDR-TB.. 23% reduction of TB incidence rate from 86.0/100,000 to 67.0/100,000 population. Improve managerial capacities of the TB program; enhance the monitoring and evaluation system and operational research, by implementing and making functional an electronic TB register in all CDTs.. Provide early TB detection in the general population and intensify case finding in prioritized high-risk groups so that the proportion of TB cases all forms identified among high-risk groups increases from 14% to at least 24% by mid-2018.

title.narrative: RWA-T-MOH Progress Report
RWA-T-MOH Program Agreement 4
RWA-T-MOH Program Agreement 5
RWA-T-MOH Grant Performance Report
RWA-T-MOH Grant Performance Report
RWA-T-MOH Grant Performance Report
RWA-T-MOH Implementation Letter 1
RWA-T-MOH Implementation Letter 2
RWA-T-MOH Implementation Letter 3
RWA-T-MOH Implementation Letter 4
RWA-T-MOH Implementation Letter 5
Coverage / Output indicator for RWA-T-MOH
Percentage of notified TB cases, all forms, contributed by non-NTP providers - community referrals
Percentage of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients on ART during TB treatment
Percentage of HIV-positive registered TB patients given anti-retroviral therapy during TB treatment
DOTS-other 1: Percentage of clinically diagnosed TB cases (new and relapse) that are successfully treated (treatment completed)
TCP-Other 2: LTBI treatment coverage among contacts under 5
TCP-Other 3: Percentage of TB cases notified in high-risk groups among all TB cases
Percentage of TB patients with DST result for at least Rifampicin among the total number of notified (new and retreatment) cases in the same year
Percentage of previously treated TB patients receiving DST (bacteriologically positive cases only)
DOTS-other 2: Percentage of bacteriologically-confirmed TB cases that are successfully treated (cured plus treatment completed)

Treatment success rate- all forms: Percentage of TB cases, all forms, bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, successfully treated (cured plus treatment completed) among all TB cases registered for treatment during a specified period, new and relapse cases
TCP-Other 1: Case notification rate of all forms of TB per 100,000 population - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases
MDR TB-Other 1: Treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB : Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated on shorter regimen
Number of notified cases of all forms of TB (i.e. bacteriologically confirmed + clinically diagnosed), new and relapse cases

MDR TB-Other 1: Percentage of bacteriologically-confirmed RR and/or MDR-TB cases successfully treated (cured plus completed treatment) among those enrolled on second-line anti-TB treatment during the year of assessment
Number of TB cases (all forms) notified among key affected populations/high risk groups
Impact indicator for RWA-T-MOH
TB mortality rate
TB prevalence rate
TB mortality rate per 100,000 population
TB incidence rate per 100,000 population
TB incidence rate
Outcome indicator for RWA-T-MOH
Treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB: Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated
Treatment success rate of all forms of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases

TB treatment coverage: Percentage of new and relapse cases that were notified and treated among the estimated number of incident TB cases in the same year (all form of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed)
